Assumption: Synthetic insights reflect real user behavior
Risk Description: Synthetic interviews may produce "hallucinated" insights not validated by real users
Mitigation Strategy: Validate top 5 insights with 10+ real parent interviews before Stage 05

Assumption: Parents will adopt without extensive onboarding
Risk Description: Parents may find setup too complex or time-consuming
Mitigation Strategy: Design 60-second onboarding; measure drop-off at each step

Assumption: Children will stay engaged with saving over weeks
Risk Description: Gamification may be insufficient for sustained engagement
Mitigation Strategy: Test reward frequency and visual progress mechanics in Stage 03 interviews

Assumption: KVKK/GDPR-K compliance is achievable at startup scale
Risk Description: Child data regulations may require specialized legal infrastructure
Mitigation Strategy: Engage KVKK consultant before Stage 07; design for minimal data collection

Assumption: Core habit loop is sufficient for MVP
Risk Description: Feature creep may delay launch and dilute focus
Mitigation Strategy: Strict PRD gate in Stage 05; no features outside Earn-Save-Achieve

Assumption: Turkish market is receptive to digital allowance tools
Risk Description: Cultural preference for cash allowance may limit adoption
Mitigation Strategy: Include cash-tracking mode; research cultural attitudes in Stage 02

Assumption: Mobile-first PWA can deliver native-like experience
Risk Description: PWA limitations may impact UX quality
Mitigation Strategy: Evaluate React Native if PWA testing underperforms in Stage 07

Assumption: Children feel disconnected from saving progress
Risk Description: If children don't actually feel this pain the core value prop fails
Mitigation Strategy: Validate in SUI interviews with specific scenarios about piggy banks and waiting

Assumption: Parents struggle with consistency in allowance management
Risk Description: If parents don't have this pain they won't adopt
Mitigation Strategy: Ask parents about failed attempts at teaching money in SUI interviews

Assumption: Both parent and child must be engaged for retention
Risk Description: If only one user engages the product fails
Mitigation Strategy: Design features requiring both users; measure paired DAU
